info.description: Summary of P. berghei proteins detected in mixed asexual blood stages, gametocytes, ookinetes, oocysts and sporozoites by MudPIT analysis.

Expression data for the P. berghei for four stages (Rings, Young Trophozoite, Young Schizont, Mature Schizont) using Mature Trophozoite as reference.

There are two datasets: HP and HPE. HP is High Producer (as in gametocytes) and HPE is High Producer "E". HP was mechanically passaged on a weekly basis from mouse to mouse and 10 independent experiments were set up (HPA-HPJ). The parasites were observed, waiting for non-producing parasites to appear. HPE was the chosen one. A deletion in HP was assumed to have created HPE (they are otherwise isogenic) and KO'd the production of gametocytes. In such a scenario the non-producer would quickly overgrow the producer. Both are cloned.

Expression data for the P. berghei for four stages (Rings, Young Trophozoite, Young Schizont, Mature Schizont) using Mature Trophozoite as reference.

There are two datasets: HP and HPE. HP is High Producer (as in gametocytes) and HPE is High Producer "E". HP was mechanically passaged on a weekly basis from mouse to mouse and 10 independent experiments were set up (HPA-HPJ). The parasites were observed, waiting for non-producing parasites to appear. HPE was the chosen one. A deletion in HP was assumed to have created HPE (they are otherwise isogenic) and KO'd the production of gametocytes. In such a scenario the non-producer would quickly overgrow the producer. Both are cloned.
Expression data for the P. falciparum DD2 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF).
Expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF).
Expression data for the P. falciparum HB3 strain during the erythocytic stage generated by the DeRisi lab (UCSF). Described in Bozdech et al. PloS Biology 1:E5, 2003.
Cell cycle expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute).
Gametocyte expression data for the P. falciparum 3D7 strain generated by the Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute).

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'Molecular mechanism for switching of P.falciparum invasion pathways into human erythrocytes' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory %RESOURCE_VERSION%

info.displayName: P. falciparum invasion pathways - array data
info.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research
info.description: The malaria parasite, P. falciparum, exploits multiple ligand-receptor interactions, called invasion pathways, to invade the host erythrocyte. Strains of P. falciparum vary in their dependency on sialated red cell receptors for invasion. We show that switching from sialic acid-dependent to independent invasion is reversible and depends on parasite ligand utilisation. Expression of reticulocyte-binding like homologue 4 (PfRh4) correlates with sialic acid-independent invasion and PfRh4 is essential for switching invasion pathways. Differential activation of PfRh4 represents a novel mechanism of invasion pathway control and provides P.falciparum with exquisite adaptability in the face of erythrocyte receptor polymorphisms and host immune responses. (taken from GEO record GSE2878)

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%

info.displayName: P. falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout - array data
info.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research
info.description: Expression profiling of 3D7 silent information regulator 2 homolog (Sir2) knockout at ring stage, 8 hours post-invasion. Results identify Sir2-mediated, reversible heterochromatin silencing as one tier of epigenetic regulation of the antigenic variation var gene family. (taken from GEO record GDS1350)

resource.pluginArgs: --studyName 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions' --headerMappingFile @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @dataDir@/%RESOURCE_VERSION%

info.displayName: Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites - array data
info.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research
info.description: Analysis of reticulocyte binding-like homolog 2b (PfRh2b) null mutant 3D7 parasites. D10 isolate naturally lacks PfRh2b. Silencing of PfRh2b, a key invasion ligand, leads to altered invasion receptor dependency. Results provide insight into the molecular basis for invasion via an alternate pathway. (taken from GEO record GDS2346)

info.displayName: Comparison of Various P. falciparum Knock outs - Invasion Pathways
info.institution: The Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

info.displayName: Distinct physiological states of Plasmodium falciparum in malaria infected patients - expression profiles
info.description: To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported custom made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.

info.displayName: Distinct physiological states of Plasmodium falciparum in malaria infected patients
info.description: To explore parasite in vivo biology we measured parasite steady state whole genome transcription using a previously reported cust om made Affy array (Scrmalaria) based on the laboratory strain 3D7.

info.displayName: 3D7AH1S2 vs. 3D7S8.4 (ring, trophozite and schizont) - array data
info.description: Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establ ishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones ( 3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fif teen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 c ompared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DN A/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w , PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other varian t gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of tran scripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones whil e the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcrip tional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics.

info.displayName: Transcriptional profile throughout 48-h intraerythrocytic cycle of three distinct P. vivax isolates
info.institution: School of Biological Sciences, Nanyang Technological University
info.description: Transcriptional profile throughout the 48-h intraerythrocytic cycle of three distinct P. vivax isolates.

info.displayName: Winzeler Pyoelii mixed RMAouput naturalscale expression data
info.description: Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute) performed comparative expression analysis on Plasmodium parasite life cycle data derived from P. falciparum blood, sporozoite, zygote and ookinete stages, and P. yoelii mosquito oocyst and salivary gland sporozoites, blood and liver stages and show that type II fatty acid biosynthesis genes are upregulated in liver and insect stages relative to asexual blood stages.

Sporozoites were purified from dissected mosquitoes fed on monkeys infected with the genome reference strain Salvador I at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, Georgia. Asexual blood stage parasites were obtained from P. vivax-infected patients in Iquitos, Peru. White blood cells were removed by CF-11 cellulose column filtration, asexual parasites were enriched by gradient centrifugation and purified by saponin lysis of RBCs. Total RNA was isolated from purified parasites and subjected to two rounds of RNA amplification for microarray analysis as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008). Experimental technical replicate hybridizations were performed for the single sporozoite sample and two asexual samples (CM012 and CM013). Gene expression values were calculated using MOID; expression profiles were clustered using OPI as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008).

Scott J Westenberger, Colleen M McClean, Rana Chattopadhyay, Neekesh V Dharia, Jane M Carlton, John W Barnwell, William E Collins, Stephen L Hoffman, Yingyao Zhou, Joseph M Vinetz, Elizabeth A Winzeler. Plasmodium vivax transcriptome analysis reveals divergent in vivo blood stage profiles and species-specific sporozoite gene expression. (in submission)

info.displayName: P. yoelii liver stage expression data fold change
info.description: P. yoelii liver stage expression data from Kappe lab. Seattle Biomedical Research Institute 307 Westlake Ave N, Suite 500, Seattle, WA, 98109 206-256-7205

Plasmodium falciparum directly from the blood of infected individuals was cultured to examine patterns of mature-stage gene expression in patient isolates. Statistical estimation of cell-cycle progression and lineage commitment in Plasmodium falciparum reveals a homogeneous pattern of transcription in ex vivo culture, data provided by Chris I. Newbold, Weatherall Institute of Molecular Medicine, Molecular Parasitology Group.

ChIP-on-chip profiling of H3, H3K4me3, H3K9me3, and H3K9ac of P. falciparum from asynchronous parasites revealed an extensively euchromatic epigenome with heterochromatin restricted to variant surface antigen gene families (VSA) and a number of genes hitherto unlinked to VSA. Contact Henk Stunnenberg, h.stunnenberg@ncmls.ru.nl, NCMLS Radboud Universiteit.
